llc.name: Limited Liability Company (LLC)
llc.description: A flexible business structure that combines the liability protection of a corporation with the tax benefits and simplicity of a partnership.
advantages: Limited liability protection for all members
Fewer formalities and paperwork than corporations
No restriction on number of owners
disadvantages: Potentially higher fees in some states
Less established legal precedent than corporations
May be more difficult to raise capital

taxation.default: Pass-through (reported on owners' personal tax returns)

types: Member-managed: All owners participate in management
Manager-managed: Designated managers (can be members or non-members) handle operations

common_forms.formation: Articles of Organization / Certificate of Formation
common_forms.governance: Operating Agreement (internal document, typically not filed with state)

corporation.name: Corporation (C Corporation)
corporation.description: A legal entity separate from its owners, providing the strongest liability protection but subject to more regulations and potential double taxation.
advantages: Limited liability protection for all shareholders
Easier to raise capital through stock sales
Potential tax advantages for reinvested profits
disadvantages: Double taxation (corporate level and shareholder level)
Less flexibility in management and profit distribution

taxation.default: C Corporation (separate entity paying corporate tax rates)
options: S Corporation (pass-through taxation, requires election and has ownership restrictions)

management.structure: Board of Directors oversees major decisions, Officers handle day-to-day operations, Shareholders own the company and elect the board

common_forms.formation: Articles of Incorporation / Certificate of Incorporation
common_forms.governance: Bylaws (internal document, typically not filed with state)

s_corporation.name: S Corporation
s_corporation.description: A corporation that elects to pass corporate income, losses, deductions, and credits through to shareholders for federal tax purposes.
advantages: Limited liability protection for all shareholders
Potential tax savings on self-employment taxes
Separate legal entity with perpetual existence
disadvantages: Ownership restrictions (100 or fewer shareholders, only U.S. citizens/residents, etc.)
All states may not recognize S corporation status

management.structure: Same as C Corporation: Board of Directors, Officers, and Shareholders

common_forms.formation: Articles of Incorporation (same as C Corporation)

partnership.name: Partnership
partnership.description: A business relationship where two or more people share ownership and operate the business together for profit.

general_partnership.name: General Partnership (GP)
general_partnership.description: Basic partnership where all partners share responsibility and liability.
general_partnership.liability: Unlimited personal liability for all partners

limited_partnership.name: Limited Partnership (LP)
limited_partnership.description: Partnership with at least one general partner (with unlimited liability) and one or more limited partners (with limited liability).
limited_partnership.liability: General partners have unlimited liability; limited partners have liability limited to their investment

limited_liability_partnership.name: Limited Liability Partnership (LLP)
limited_liability_partnership.description: Partnership where all partners have limited liability protection.
limited_liability_partnership.liability: Partners are protected from personal liability for partnership debts and other partners' actions
limited_liability_partnership.common_uses: Professional services (law firms, accounting firms, etc.)

disadvantages: Limited life (can terminate upon partner departure)

taxation.default: Pass-through to partners' personal tax returns

common_forms.formation: Partnership Agreement (typically not filed with state)

sole_proprietorship.name: Sole Proprietorship
sole_proprietorship.description: The simplest business structure where one individual owns and operates the business.
advantages: Easiest and least expensive to form
Simple tax reporting on personal return

taxation.default: Reported on owner's personal tax return (Schedule C)

common_forms.dba_filing: Fictitious Business Name Statement / DBA (if operating under a name different from owner's legal name)

liability_protection.description: Protection of personal assets from business debts and legal claims

tax_considerations.description: How business profits and losses are taxed

ease_of_formation.description: Complexity and cost of creating the business entity

raising_capital.description: Ability to attract investment and funding
